page.title: 01Broadheath area of Worcester
page.content: The study area includes the villages of Upper and Lower Broadheath and is situated north-west of the city of Worcester. It is characteristically an area of pasture and arable farming which is increasingly influenced by the close proximity of the city, of which the South Western portion of the study area is within the city boundary. The larger of the two villages lower Broadheath provides a focal point for the community, with the services of primary school, church and village stores/post office, whist the smaller hamlet of upper Broadheath provides high class housing centers around avast village green. Within the hamlet of upper Broadheath is a museum of artifacts at the birthpalce of the famous composer Sir Edward Elgar which is a major tourist attraction.
